children.subject: I think it wouldn't matter, since you are doing research and internship at the same time, so people would understand.

As a past 5th year, research is the biggest thing they look at.

Dropping a class is ok, they understand.

history.content:
Hi, I wanted to post this question here to get some advice.

My goal is to get into the 5th year M.S. program. I'm currently doing research and have secured a faculty advisor for the program, along with a few letters of rec from the profs involved in my research + industry (including my manager from my current internship). I'm also currently interning at a big tech co, while also taking CS186 + 2 breadths. Now that classes are going at full speed, CS186 has been pretty overwhelming with all my other commitments, so I'm thinking of dropping it.

Would it be a bad look for my 5th year M.S. application if I didn't take a CS course this semester (but I'm still taking 2 extremely easy breadths w/o almost 0 workload, research 10-20 hrs/week, interning at FAANG)? This CS course would be my last req for the major, so I'd be taking it next semester instead. This would give me more time to focus on my research this semester instead of the class, but I don't want to drop the class if it will have a detrimental look for my application.
history.subject: Semester without CS Class for 5th Year M.S.
